alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 3:18AM CST until January 05 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: .OVERVIEW...a winter storm will bring snow and strong winds to the region from later tonight through the better part of Wednesday. Snow accumulations will hold mostly along and north of Interstate 90. Strong winds will impact the entire area, gusting as high as 40 to 50 mph at times. The winds will blow and drift the existing snow cover, along with what falls. Visibilities could be significantly reduced. Peak impact times for the snow and wind look to come from midnight through noon Wednesday. There will be travel impacts, including the Wednesday morning commute. Plan now and be prepared to adjust travel if conditions warrant it. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph resulting in blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Wednesday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.
